designations.source: A review of the scarce and threatened beetles of Great Britain Part 1 (Hyman, P.S. revised and updated by M.S. Parsons)
designations.source_description: Hyman, P S revised and updated by Parsons, M S.  UK nature conservation, No. 3.  Published by JNCC, 1992.  Along with Part 2, updates relevant information in the RDB Insects (1987) using the old IUCN categories and criteria (pre 1994).
designations.reporting_category: Rare and scarce species (not based on IUCN criteria)
designations.designation_description: Taxa which do not fall within RDB categories but which are none-the-less uncommon in Great Britain and thought to occur in between 31 and 100 10km squares of the National Grid or, for less-well recorded groups between eight and twenty vice-counties. Superseded by Nationally Scarce, and therefore no longer in use.

designations.source: A review of the scarce and threatened Coleoptera of Great Britain Part (3)- Water beetles of Great Britain
designations.source_description: Foster, G.N. 2010. A review of the scarce and threatened Coleoptera of Great Britain Part (3)- Water beetles of Great Britain. Species Status 1. Joint Nature Conservation Committee, Peterborough.
designations.reporting_category: Red listing based on 2001 IUCN guidelines
designations.designation_description: Taxa which do not qualify for Lower Risk (conservation dependent), but which are close to qualifying for Vulnerable. In Britain, this category includes species which occur in 15 or fewer hectads but do not qualify as Critically Endangered, Endangered or Vulnerable.
